alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:21AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lamoille, northwestern Orange, north central Addison, southeastern Chittenden and northwestern Washington Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 520 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hinesburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall. Heavy rain with hourly rates between 1 and 2 inches per hours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montpelier, South Burlington, Monkton Ridge, Waterbury Village, Monkton, Waitsfield, Monkton Boro, Berlin, Fayston, Williston, Worcester, Middlesex, Bolton, Richmond, Hinesburg, Northfield Village, St. George, Huntington, Northfield and Duxbury. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 45 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
